channel.title: Keeping It Real: Conversations with Jillian Michaels
channel.description: Fun, inspirational, informative, and empowering, Keeping It Real: Conversations with Jillian Michaels showcases weekly, in depth interviews with the world's foremost experts in all fields of wellness. From medicine, fitness, and nutrition to parenting, money, and relationships, the show focusses on facts and authenticity. Guests like Dr. Sanjay Gupta, Lisa Ling, Tony Robbins, Suze Orman, Dr. Gail Saltz, Lindsey Vonn, Iliza Shlesinger, Kelly McGonigal, and more, give the audience all the info needed to enhance their lives in any way they choose to. So join Jillian each week and learn from top doctors, athletes, entrepreneurs, scientists, and more.
channel.itunes:author: Jillian Michaels | Crossover Media Group

image.title: Keeping It Real: Conversations with Jillian Michaels

item.title: PCOS, Infertility, and Other Reproductive Endocrinology Issues, with Dr. Heather Huddleston
item.description:
Dr. Heather Huddleston joins Jillian this week to break down everything you need to know if you're struggling with hormonal function, infertility, polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS), recurrent pregnancy loss, and uterine disorders like Asherman's syndrome. From diet, lifestyle, medications and more – Dr. Huddleston shares all kinds of possible treatments.

Guest Links:

UCSF PCOS Clinic Website: https://www.ucsfhealth.org/clinics/pcos-clinic

IG: https://www.instagram.com/ucsf_pcos_clinic/

UCSF PCOS Challenge: https://pcoschallenge.org/ucsf-pcos-research-study/

Virtual Medical Care for PCOS: https://allarahealth.com

item.title: The Anti-Viral Gut - Mastering the Connection Between Gut Health, Microbiome & the Immune System, with Dr. Robynne Chutkan
item.description:
Dr. Robynne Chutkan - gastroenterologist at Georgetown University Hospital, founder of the Digestive Center for Women and author of the new book, The Anti-Viral Gut -  joins Jillian on this week’s show. She's teaching us how to master our microbiome in order to boost immunity and manage autoimmune conditions like Crohn’s, eczema, Parkinson’s, hives, Raynaud’s, and more. From fighting off STDs to preventing long Covid, the bacteria in your gut can make you bullet proof if you know how to cultivate and care for them.

Guest Links:

Her new book, The Anti-Viral Gut: Tackling Pathogens from the Inside Out

IG: @Gutbliss

Website: RobynneChutkan.com

“Free Office Hours” Tuesdays at Noon ET: https://robynnechutkan.com/office-hours-with-dr-c/

item.title: Learn To Reverse Diseases Like Type-2 Diabetes, Erectile Dysfunction, and PCOS!
item.description:
First up, Jillian tackles the big business agenda behind the “healthy at any size” narrative. Stop Big Food and Big Pharma from making you sick and profiting off it! Next, the dangers of identifying with your health condition and how to stop. Then, what metabolic disease actually is, the havoc it creates in the body, and the comorbidities it’s linked to. From erectile dysfunction and glaucoma, to type 2 diabetes and depression – you can reverse it. Plus, listener questions on sagging skin, estrogen replacement, “oblique fat,” fat-burning hacks, and more!


For 25% off The Fitness App by Jillian Michaels, go to www.thefitnessapp.com/podcastdeal

item.title: The Life Changing Power of Making Amends, with Rabbi Danya Ruttenberg
item.description:
Rabbi Danya Ruttenberg, award-winning writer and author of the book ON REPENTANCE AND REPAIR: Making Amends in an Unapologetic World, joins Jillian to talk about the life changing power of making amends. She discusses taking responsibility, learning from mistakes, and repairing relationships in all aspects of our lives. Being able to focus on the person you upset allows you both to heal, grow closer, and develop personally. The Rabbi takes us through the 5-step process of 1) Confession: fully owning what you did, without judgment. 2) Starting to change: figuring out why you did it and what you need to do about it. 3) Amends: asking the person you harmed what you can do to make it right. 4) Apology: truly understanding how hurt the other person is. 5) Making different choices moving forward.

Guest Links:

Website: https://danyaruttenberg.net/  

Twitter: @TheRaDR

Instagram: rabbidanyaruttenberg


For 25% off The Fitness App by Jillian Michaels, go to www.thefitnessapp.com/podcastdeal

item.title: The Keys to Excellent Heart Health, with Cardiologist Dr. Haider Warraich
item.description:
Heart health is the top killer of women globally - and it’s avoidable!! World renown cardiologist Dr. Haider Warraich is on with Jillian to discuss what tests our doctors should be running for proactive heart health and what age to start. Plus, he teaches us how we can manage our blood pressure; what cholesterol numbers mean for your LDL, HDL, total cholesterol, and triglycerides; what to do about hypertension; top strategies to remove plaque from the blood vessels; the risks and benefits of statins and other medications (like PCSK 9 inhibitors); supplements, aspirin, and vaccinations to lower cholesterol. Dr. Warraich also tackles questions on how to manage other factors for heart disease like genetics, environment, and lifestyle changes to help us transform our heart health.

Guest Links:

Dr. Warraich’s books: 

The Song of Our Scars: The Untold Story of Pain

item.itunes:title: The Keys to Excellent Heart Health, with Cardiologist Dr. Haider Warraich
item.itunes:summary:
Heart health is the top killer of women globally - and it’s avoidable!! World renown cardiologist Dr. Haider Warraich is on with Jillian to discuss what tests our doctors should be running for proactive heart health and what age to start. Plus, he teaches us how we can manage our blood pressure; what cholesterol numbers mean for your LDL, HDL, total cholesterol, and triglycerides; what to do about hypertension; top strategies to remove plaque from the blood vessels; the risks and benefits of statins and other medications (like PCSK 9 inhibitors); supplements, aspirin, and vaccinations to lower cholesterol. Dr. Warraich also tackles questions on how to manage other factors for heart disease like genetics, environment, and lifestyle changes to help us transform our heart health.
Guest Links:
Dr. Warraich’s books:
The Song of Our Scars: The Untold Story of Pain
State of the Heart: Exploring the History, Science and Future of Cardiac Disease
Twitter: @haiderwarraich

item.title: The Transformative Power of Cold Therapy, with Dr. Mark Harper
item.description:
Dr. Mark Harper, MD, PHD joins Jillian to discuss the health benefits of cold water therapy and cold water swimming. From inflammation and autoimmune conditions to mood boosting and migraine management, the results are incredible, affordable and accessible. Plus, Dr. Harper gives us all a prescription on how to get started, how long to expose yourself to the cold and how often, for optimal benefits.

item.description:
Dr. William Li -- physician, scientist, president and medical director of the Angiogenesis Foundation, and author of Eat to Beat Disease -- joins Jillian to discuss the top foods to prevent or slow breast cancer growth and support thyroid function. Plus, he takes us on a deep dive into “anti-nutrients” like nightshades, lectins, goitrogens, and more. Get the truth and learn to cut through the diet nonsense to optimize your health and eat to beat disease.

item.title: The Power of Pooping: A Cheeky Diet and Lifestyle Guide to End Constipation and Transform Your Health, with TikTok sensation Nurse Susan Wong
item.description:
Retired nurse-turned TikTok sensation Susan Wong joins Jillian this week to discuss her 40+ years of experience on finding gut-friendly food, fighting against inflammation, and getting your hands on the necessary nutrients you need to poop better. Whether you need to conquer constipation, eliminate gas, manage or avoid hemorrhoids, analyze your poop to immediately identify potential health issues or concerns, Nurse Wong has you covered. She even teaches us proper pelvic floor care and booty hygiene to avoid any future issues and stay your absolute most fresh!

item.title: Quieting Internal and External Noise to Find Your Purpose and Live with Passion, with Justin Zorn & Leigh Marz
item.description:
Justin Zorn and Leigh Marz teach us how to go beyond the ordinary rules and tools of mindfulness while navigating the noise of the modern world—not just the noise in our ears but also on our screens and in our heads. Drawing on lessons from neuroscience, business, spirituality, politics, and the arts, Marz and Zorn explore why auditory, informational, and internal silence is essential for physical health, mental clarity, ecological sustainability, and a vibrant community.

Guest Links:

item.title: How to Drop 100lbs, Fast and Forever!
item.description:
Weight loss has become a third rail conversation in the United States, but it’s arguably the number one killer of Americans. But if that doesn’t motivate you, maybe better sex, better energy, better sleep, better digestion, better immunity and more will. In this episode, Jillian gives all the practical advice of what to do and why to do it to lose the weight permanently. You’ll even hear from a woman who lost 104 pounds and kept it off. Learn how she did it and be inspired to know that you can do it too!

item.title: Overcoming Anxiety & Depression While Revitalizing Your Life, with Dr. Gregory Scott Brown
item.description:
From medication to talk therapy, we often forget about self-care in our mental health discussions. Dr. Brown redefines living with purpose, balance, contentment, and hope with his 5-step plan to overcome anxiety and depression. Utilizing sleep hygiene, specific anti-inflammatory foods, a diet to combat anxiety and depression, BDNF fitness techniques, vagus nerve activation, and more, Dr. Brown teaches us all how to heal our minds and revitalize our lives.

item.title: Breaking The Age Code, with Dr. Becca Levy
item.description:
Did you know that your thoughts about age actually impact your genes, as well as everything from cognitive function to physical fitness? This week, Dr. Becca Levy, PhD, author of Breaking the Age Code: How Your Beliefs About Aging Determine How Long and Well You Live joins Jillian to shed some light on how our age beliefs affect our health, for better or for worse, and what we can do to age in reverse!

item.title: The Power of The Downstate - Sleep, Recovery, Meditation, Melatonin & More, with Dr. Sara Mednick
item.description:
Dr. Sara C. Mednick, PhD, author of THE POWER OF THE DOWNSTATE: Recharge Your Life Using Your Body's Own Restorative Systems, talks with Jillian about the importance of honoring circadian rhythms, melatonin, blue light blockers, and more for metabolism, immunity, and disease prevention. She explains the best times to sleep, eat, and exercise for optimal health. Plus, she tells us key supplements, breathing exercises, and lifestyle habits for better recovery, more energy, and a longer life.

item.title: Brain-Body Parenting: How to Stop Managing Behavior & Start Raising Joyful, Resilient Kids, with Dr. Mona Delahooke
item.description:
Dr. Mona Delahooke, clinical psychologist and author of Brain-Body Parenting: How to Stop Managing Behavior and Start Raising Joyful, Resilient Kids, is on for a deeper dive into the parenting conversation. The entire parenting system is focused on behavior and compliance, but is it actually working for our kids? Many behaviors are subconscious, so how do we engage a new way forward with “brain body parenting” to help our kids make good choices and consider the future impact of those choices? Dr. Delahooke teaches us to do that by focusing on what is causing our kids’ behavior rather than the behavior itself, setting good boundaries, setting examples, and being empathetic. 

Guest Links:

Website: http://monadelahooke.com

IG: https://www.instagram.com/monadelahooke/

item.title: The Authority Gap: Why Women Are Taken Less Seriously Than Men—and What We Can Do About It, with Mary Ann Sieghart
item.description:
London-based journalist and broadcaster Mary Ann Sieghart, author of The Authority Gap discusses why we accept men on their word and question women on theirs. Even women are biased against women! We explore how this global dynamic affects us in all aspects of our lives, personally and professionally, and what we can do to level the playing field!

item.title: The Four-Week Plan To Live Your Longest, Healthiest Life, with Dan Buettner
item.description:
Dan Buettner -- NYT best-selling author, National Geographic Explorer, and founder of The Blue Zones -- joins Jillian to discuss his latest book, The Blue Zones Challenge: A 4-Week Plan for a Longer, Better Life. The Blue Zones Challenge is about how to set up your life for health and longevity, with habits and behaviors that become a lifestyle. Dan and Jillian dive into the specifics of Blue Zone diets, from complex carbs to healthy fats like olive oil, grains, beans, nuts, seasonal fruits and vegetables. Learn to set up your kitchen, community, social group and more so you’re damn near guaranteed to live to 100!

Guest Links:

Websites:

https://danbuettner.com

https://www.bluezones.com

Books available on Amazon and on Dan’s website:

item.itunes:summary:
Dan Buettner -- NYT best-selling author, National Geographic Explorer, and founder of The Blue Zones -- joins Jillian to discuss his latest book, The Blue Zones Challenge: A 4-Week Plan for a Longer, Better Life. The Blue Zones Challenge is about how to set up your life for health and longevity, with habits and behaviors that become a lifestyle. Dan and Jillian dive into the specifics of Blue Zone diets, from complex carbs to healthy fats like olive oil, grains, beans, nuts, seasonal fruits and vegetables. Learn to set up your kitchen, community, social group and more so you’re damn near guaranteed to live to 100!

item.title: Protect Your Aging Brain, Manage Perimenopause Symptoms, and the Breast Cancer/Hormone Connection, with Dr. Lisa Mosconi
item.description:
What can we do to protect our brain as we age? How can we stay vital? What about HRT and breast cancer? Can we actually manage symptoms of perimenopause? Dr. Lisa Mosconi, leading neuroscientist, nutritionist and Director of the Women’s Brain Initiative and the Alzheimer's Prevention Program at Weill Cornell/New York Presbyterian tells all! She joins Jillian on this week’s show to discuss what happens to women’s brains and hormones in puberty, pregnancy, and perimenopause, and what we can do about it.  Dr. Mosconi covers everything from the pros and cons of HRT (hormone replacement therapy), the breast cancer/hormone connection, and top strategies to manage postpartum, perimenopause, and help prevent Alzheimer’s using exercise, diet, stress reduction, and more. 

Guest Links:

Lisa’s research: https://neurology.weill.cornell.edu/research/womens-brain-initiative

Website: https://www.lisamosconi.com

IG: @dr_mosconi, @avery_books

Dr. Mosconi’s previous segment in this episode from 3/30/20:

https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/pandemic-pandemonium-preventing-alzheimers-parenting/id418368811?i=1000469942543

item.title: The Science Behind Heartbreak and How to Heal From It, with Florence Williams
item.description:
Journalist & author Florence Williams joins Jillian to discuss her new book, Heartbreak: A Personal and Scientific Journey. Florence explains how humans are hard wired for pair bonding, the powerful effects love has on our brain chemistry, and the physiological consequences of a “breakup,”  from hormonal imbalance and compromised immune function to increased inflammation and elevated risk of heart failure. Florence then walks us through how to heal by finding calm, connection, and purpose. 

Gust Links:

Website & book: http://www.florencewilliams.com

IG: @florence999

Twitter: @flowill

item.title: How Big Pharma Broke American Health Care and How We Can Repair It, with John Abramson
item.description:
Harvard Medical School Lecturer and national drug litigation expert John Abramson is on to talk about his new book Sickening: How Big Pharma Broke American Health Care and How We Can Repair It. We cover everything from how data is misrepresented to get drugs on the market, the deadly effects of pharma lobbying and, most importantly, some solutions for how each and every one of us can help get America’s healthcare system back on track! 

Link to the book:

Sickening: How Big Pharma Broke American Health Care and How We Can Repair It

item.title: Everything You Need To Know About Omega 3’s, Prebiotics, Joint Support Supplements, Waist Trainers & More!
item.description:
This week, Jillian digs in on the best and worst types of seafood to maximize all the benefits of omega 3 fatty acids, like heart health and cognitive function. Find out the best types of fish to eat and which ones to avoid to minimize exposure to heavy metals or environmental toxins. She also tackles the relationship between pre and probiotics and outlines the best sources of each to optimize gut health and support a healthy microbiome. Plus, listener questions answered on everything from waist trainers, joint support supplements, how to start a workout regimen, “negative calorie foods,” and more.

item.title: Healing Back Injuries Once and For All, with Dr. Stuart McGill
item.description:
Jillian opens up about her life changing injury -- fracturing her spine and herniating three discs. She’s joined by the world’s foremost expert in rehabilitating spine injuries and healing back pain, Dr Stuart McGill. They discuss everything from injury prevention and pain management to proper injury assessment and the importance of identifying the right course of action to ensure successful rehabilitation. If you live with chronic pain, or struggle with a current or old injury that diminishes your quality of life, this is a must listen. 

GUEST LINKS:

Back Mechanic and other books by Dr. McGill: https://www.backfitpro.com/books/

Website: https://www.backfitpro.com

item.description:

item.title: Caring for Aging Loved Ones & Preserving Their Dignity While Safe-Guarding Your Mental Health, with Amy O’Rourke
item.description:
Professional care manager for 4 decades and best-selling author of The Fragile Years Amy O’Rourke joins Jillian to discuss how to care for our aging loved ones. She dives in on how to make important health care decisions for them, find financial aid for their care, preserve their dignity, manage stress levels, preserve mental health for all, and so much more. From knowing when it’s time to take the keys to knowing how to help your loved one with memory loss, Amy leaves no stone unturned in guiding us through all the difficult and challenging scenarios. 

Guest Links:

The book: The Fragile Years 

Website - Agingexpert.com 

Facebook -- https://www.facebook.com/amycameronorourke

LinkedIn -- https://www.linkedin.com/in/amy-o-rourke/

Additional links & materials discussed in this episode: 

https://www.aginglifecare.org//

“The 36 Hour Day” by Nancy L. Mace & Peter V. Rabins

item.title: The Game-Changing Impact of Regenerative Agriculture on the Environment and Our Overall Health, with Farmer Lee Jones
item.description:
Farmer Lee Jones, regenerative agriculture specialist, joins Jillian to discuss the power of farming efficiently, ethically, and effectively. The way our food is farmed impacts our health in a myriad of ways! Chemicals sprayed on crops affect not only our physical health, but the health of our environment. Food grown in the proper climates with regenerated soil has far more nutrients. Sustainable farming creates sustainable jobs. Learn how to make healthy, sustainable, ethical choices with your food shopping!

Guest Links:

Instagram: @farmerleejones and @farmerjonesfarm

Home Delivery: farmerjonesfarm.com

item.title: Dealing with Cultural Stigmas, with Professor Roy Richard Grinker
item.description:
ROY RICHARD GRINKER, professor of anthropology and international affairs at George Washington University, and author of the book, Nobody’s Normal: How Culture Created the Stigma of Mental Illness joins Jillian to discuss how culture contributes to the stigma of obesity, mental illness, and homophobia. Plus, we look at how mental illness is viewed in other nations, and how society and environment can be part of the solution. We also cover how parents can pass on trauma to a baby through epigenetics and what we can do about it.

Guest Links:

Twitter: @roygrinker

Websites:

https://anthropology.columbian.gwu.edu/roy-richard-grinker

www.royrichardgrinker.com

item.title: How to Become a Millionaire, with GaryVee
item.description:
GaryVee (Vaynercuk) is one of the leading global minds on what’s next in culture, relevance, and the internet, as well as being one of the most forward thinkers in business, marketing, and branding. Gary tells us what it takes to be a business juggernaut, dishes on his new book Twelve And A Half, opens up about his personal journey to success, and reminds all of us that it’s literally never to late to become a millionaire, having a achieved success in his late 30’s. One of our most informative and inspiring business shows to date.

item.title: Inside the FDA with a Former FDA Director, Richard Williams
item.description:
Richard A. Williams, former Director for Social Science with the Center for Food Safety and Applied Nutrition at the FDA, takes us behind the scenes on what the FDA actually does: how regulations are put into place, and why they sometimes aren’t when they should be; how warning labels and bans on things like trans fats are determined, and by whom; food safety versus nutrition, and Genetically Modified versus Genetically Engineered. Is irradiation (similar to microwaves) a safe way to kill pathogens in food? Why is obesity still on the rise? And we take a look at the future of food, from precision fermentation, vertical farms, and 3D-printed foods, to personalized diets and so much more.

Guest Links:

Website: https://www.richardawilliams.com


For 25% off The Fitness App by Jillian Michaels, go to www.thefitnessapp.com/podcastdeal

Follow us on Instagram @JillianMichaels and @MartiniCindy

Email your questions to JillianPodcast@gmail.com

item.title: World Renowned Virologist Vincent Racaniello, Unbiased and Unfiltered!
item.description:
World class virologist Vincent Racaniello joins Jillian to talk mRNA technology, breakthrough infections, booster shots, the Delta variant, Covid antivirals, vaccine side effects and more. You won’t find a more unbiased, fact-based show with all the information you need to make the best decisions for you and your family!

Guest Links:

item.title: Calories: What Exactly Are They, How Are They Calculated, And Why You Need To Know!
item.description:
This week, Jillian and crew look at a new study that debunks how the foods we eat are assigned a caloric value and what this means to your daily diet. Plus, listener questions that address snacks for breast-feeding moms, craving hacks, motivation secrets, and overcoming “DOMS” (delayed onset muscle soreness) after a workout.

item.title: Medical Decision Making - Your Life Depends On It, with Dr. Talya Miron-Shatz
item.description:
Dr. Talya Miron-Shatz is a Ph.D. in psychology, as well as an internationally acclaimed expert in medical decision-making. This week, she breaks down her new book, Your Life Depends on It: What You Can Do to Make Better Choices About Your Health, teaching us how to ensure that information is conveyed thoroughly and clearly, our choices are constructed as intelligently as possible, and our interactions with our medical professionals are handled in a way that optimizes our health for the best possible outcomes. This episode might save your life one day.

Guest Links:

The new book: Your Life Depends on It

Website: https://talyamironshatz.com

Twitter: https://twitter.com/talyamironshatz

LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/talya-miron-shatz

item.title: This is Your Brain on Food, with Dr. Uma Naidoo
item.description:
Harvard-trained nutritional psychiatrist, professional chef, and author of This is Your Brain on Food Dr. Uma Naidoo discusses the 6 pillars of nutritional psychology and foods to fight depression, manage anxiety, and combat ADHD. Plus, she explains the power of our gut-brain connection and the important roll the vagus nerve plays in our physical and mental well-being. 

Guest Links:

To subscribe to the newsletter: https://umanaidoomd.com

This is Your Brain on Food: https://book.umanaidoomd.com

IG: @DrUmaNaidoo

item.title: Body Positivity vs. Body Confidence, Psychotropic Drug-Based “Treatments," and Vetting “Science-Based” Health Claims
item.description:
Jillian covers the difference between body positivity and body confidence. Psychotropic drugs from marijuana to psilocybin and Ketamine are gaining traction as treatments for medical / health issues. Do they work and is it safe? Plus, people are using “science” to make all kinds of health claims from covid treatments to weight loss and diet claims. How can you tell when the science is being manipulated for profit - Jillian will tell you in this week’s show!

Start your FREE 7 day trial for Jillian’s App at https://go.jillianmichaels.com/WNt1rL7uyZ

item.title: Choosing the F*cks to Give, with Mark Manson
item.description:
Is there a secret to finding peace and happiness? Self-help guru and NYT #1 best-selling author Mark Manson says yes. In this episode, he tells us what goals are worth fighting for, what is worth caring about, where to dig in, and when to just let it go. Plus, top strategies to center yourself, focus, and enjoy life without getting bogged down in other people’s BS.

Guest Links:

item.content:encoded:
Is there a secret to finding peace and happiness? Self-help guru and NYT #1 best-selling author Mark Manson says yes. In this episode, he tells us what goals are worth fighting for, what is worth caring about, where to dig in, and when to just let it go. Plus, top strategies to center yourself, focus, and enjoy life without getting bogged down in other people’s BS.

item.title: A Radical Awakening, with Dr. Shefali
item.description:
Acclaimed author, Clinical Psychologist, and International Speaker Dr. Shefali talks about her new book, A Radical Awakening, which lays out a path for women to discover their inner truth and set themselves free in all aspects of life. Shefali is eloquent and inspiring, with practical and accessible advice that changes lives. If you are looking to uncover your purpose and harness the power of authenticity in every area of your life, you won’t want to miss this episode!

item.title: The Fountain of Youth Exists, with Dr. Dayan Goodenowe
item.description:
Dr. Dayan Goodenowe, world expert on the biochemical basis of life, disease, and death, discusses the biochemical markers that predict numerous diseases including Alzheimer’s and dementia, Parkinson’s, multiple sclerosis, stroke, autism, ALS, multiple system atrophy, various mental illnesses, and cancers - and how we can still prevent disease in spite of them!

Guest Links:

https://drgoodenowe.com

item.title: Change Your Mindset, Change Your Life, with Lily Dulan
item.description:
Jillian went to an intuit to figure out why she’s the unluckiest lucky person and started looking at what was easy in her day-to-day instead of what went wrong. And, MFT Psychotherapist Lily Dulan, author of Giving Grief Meaning, teaches us how to redefine grief in order to transcend loss, pain, and suffering.

item.title: The Role of Hormones in Health & Weight Loss, with Dr Robert Lustig
item.description:
Neuroendochrinologist and author of the new book, Metabolical: The Lure and the Lies of Processed Food, Nutrition, and Modern Medicine, Dr. Robert Lustig joins the show this week to discuss what is healthy. Why your liver is the key to so many health issues, including weight loss. The importance of fiber and feeding your gut with Real food v. processed food, the importance of fiber. And he sounds off on Keto, vegan diets, protein and BCAAs, and how big food, pharma, and government are rigging the game to make you sick. 

Guest Links:

https://metabolical.com


Start your FREE 7 day trial for Jillian’s App at https://go.jillianmichaels.com/WNt1rL7uyZ

item.title: Get Pain-Free, with Brandon Volz
item.description:
Jillian’s personal Corrective Exercise Specialist Brandon Volz is on the show to teach us how to heal our bodies with corrective movement. From knee and hip pain to neck and back pain, Brandon explains the root cause of these issues and how to fix them! Plus, he also teaches us how to move for optimal fitness and physical performance!

item.title: Dreaming Bigger and Living Richer, with Alli Webb
item.description:
This week on Keeping It Real, Bar Founder, female entrepreneur extraordinaire, and overall badass Alli Webb is on to help us turn our passion projects into a cash making machine. Webb was also named one of the “100 Most Creative People in Business” by Fast Company and included on Fortune's "40 Under 40” list! So if you’ve ever had a dream of being your own boss, growing your own company, and turning that passion project into a career - you definitely do NOT want to miss this show.

item.title: Fun Filter Your Life for Better Health, with Meaghan B. Murphy
item.description:
This week on Keeping It Real, Editor-in-Chief of Woman’s Day Magazine, Meaghan Murphy, is my guest! And she’s talking to us about her new book, "Your Fully Charged Life.” In this episode, Murphy gives us a practical guide to bringing our best self to every situation, even when the pressures of daily life leave us feeling overwhelmed and exhausted. Spanning health, work, family time, and more Murphy gives us small changes in outlook and habits that yield big results in happiness and health without ever sacrificing who you are.

Guest Links:

@meaghanbmurphy 

@theyaylist

@bestfieldnj

item.content:encoded:
This week on Keeping It Real, Editor-in-Chief of Woman’s Day Magazine, Meaghan Murphy, is my guest! And she’s talking to us about her new book, "Your Fully Charged Life.” In this episode, Murphy gives us a practical guide to bringing our best self to every situation, even when the pressures of daily life leave us feeling overwhelmed and exhausted. Spanning health, work, family time, and more Murphy gives us small changes in outlook and habits that yield big results in happiness and health without ever sacrificing who you are.

item.title: How Can I Help, with Dr. Gail Saltz
item.description:
Pandemic stress has created more loneliness and anxiety in all of us. Thankfully, Dr. Gail Saltz is back to coach us through it by giving us perspective, shifting our mindset, building community and more. Plus, she takes on a unique position on how to manage our kids’ mental health during these challenging times.

item.title: Full Circle Lessons in Love
item.description:
Hayley Quinn completes her fourth segment in a series on finding and cultivating healthy love. She digs in on dispelling dating myths that wreak havoc on your love life like: there are no good men left. Just be yourself and love will come, etc. Then, she digs into the bigger picture strategy of building a partnership versus the shorter term tactical game-play of dating. And, Jillian shares a personal story on how Haley’s love lessons have come full circle in her life! 

Send your questions for Hayley to JillianPodcast@gmail.com

item.title: Unraveling the Mysteries of the Universe with Brian Greene
item.description:
This week, Jillian has a lot of questions for theoretical physicist and mathematician Brian Greene:l Is the universe infinite? What is the most probable multiverse? Are there copies of us out there? What about the Fermi Paradox, are we alone? They tackle some of Jillian's other favorite topics as well, including parallel universes, The Double Slit Experiment, Quantum Mechanics, the nature of time, free will, alternate realities, black holes and so much more… 

Guest Link:

https://www.worldsciencefestival.com


Start your FREE 7 day trial for Jillian’s App at https://go.jillianmichaels.com/WNt1rL7uyZ

Send us your brief question at jillianpodcast@gmail.com

Follow us on Instagram @JillianMichaels and @MartiniCindy

item.title: How to Make Stress Your Friend, with Health Psychologist Kelly McGonigal
item.description:
Can changing y our mind about stress change your body’s reaction to it? Kelly McGonigal says yes and in this episode, she teaches us how. Plus, she enlightens us on how the power of movement has been shown to help boost human connection, fight depression, and even help us recover from trauma. 

Guest Links:

You can find Kelly online at kellymcgonigal.com

Her latest book, The Joy of Movement, is available now 

IG: @KellyMarieMcgonical

item.title: Trick Your Brain Into Falling Asleep, with Jim Donovan
item.description:
It’s been a rough year, but Jillian wants everyone to know that there’s a light at the end of the tunnel! And she has a lot to say about fad diets like The F-Factor, Blood-Type & Paleo. Plus, Jim Donovan is on to share ways to use rhythm to calm anxiety and teach your body to sleep.

item.title: The Power of Community in Times of Chaos
item.description:
Jillian’s personal experience with a close friend has left her at a loss as to how to support someone going through addiction and recovery. So this week, we have Lemonada Media co-founder/host of the podcast Last Day, Stephanie Wittels Wachs, on the show to talk about the importance of connecting to others.

item.title: The Death of Common Sense, with Dr. Gad Saad
item.description:
Jillian tries to zero in on why lies seem to have become a way of life, and Dr. Gad Saad, Evolutionary Behavioral Scientist and host of The Saad Truth podcast, joins to shed some light on the issue. His new book, The Parasitic Mind: How Infectious Ideas Are Killing Common Sense, is one of Jillian’s favorite reads!

Guest links:

item.title: The Social Dilemma, with Director Jeff Orlowski
item.description:
This week, Jillian talks to Jeff Orlowski, director and co-writer of the wildly popular Netflix documentary, The Social Dilemma.  In a world where our addiction to social media has been monetized, curated content controls what and how we think, polarizing us by finding our differences and playing them up for likes and comments. So what can we do about it?

item.title: FODMAP Diet, CBD Rip-Offs, Adaptogens, & More!
item.description:
For the final segment in our series, Dr. William Li shares his thoughts on adaptogens from food sources and from supplements. Plus, Jillian explores some reasons you might be bloated or constipated, and how a FODMAP diet could help determine whether it’s a food sensitivity or something more serious…and she definitely has an opinion on the latest marketing gimmick of adding CBD to anything and everything!

Guest Links:

Eat to Beat Disease: The New Science of How Your Body Can Heal Itself:

https://www.amazon.com/dp/1538714620/?ref=exp_drwilliamli_dp_vv_d

item.title: The Curative Powers of Cultural Foods
item.description:
Dr. William Li is back to go over some ingredients from different cultures that can help support your body in various ways, from boosting your immune system to killing cancer stem cells. Plus, ever wonder why hair turns grey? Jillian has some ideas on how to slow it down, and some tips on your workout recovery.

Guest Links:

Eat to Beat Disease: The New Science of How Your Body Can Heal Itself:

https://www.amazon.com/dp/1538714620/?ref=exp_drwilliamli_dp_vv_d

Instagram: @DrWilliamLi

Get the newsletter at: DrWilliamLi.com

item.title: Can We Use Food to Fix Our DNA?
item.description:
Jillian’s month-long series with Dr. William Li continues with Nutrigenomics, a new field of medicine that looks at how lifestyle and nutrition affect our DNA, and how we can use food to protect it. Plus, the #1 thing you should NOT be doing to your fruits and vegetables, and why you might want to start eating your coffee grounds!

Guest Links:

Eat to Beat Disease: The New Science of How Your Body Can Heal Itself

item.title: Foods to Rejuvenate Our Bodies, with Dr. William Li

item.title: You Achieve What You Believe!

item.title: New Bird, Who Dis?
item.description:
Between the pandemic and the general state of society, many of us are feeling helpless and depressed, so how do we keep having important conversations? And get ready for some tough love because Jillian got her results from her physical and she's more determined than ever for everyone to get healthy...and it has a lot to do with your microbiome.

TEDx Talks:

How your belly controls your brain | Ruairi Robertson:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=awtmTJW9ic8&t=712s

Your Gut Microbiome | Erika Ebbel Angle

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B9RruLkAUm8

Article:

Why One-Size-Fits-All Diets Don’t Work:

https://apple.news/A1smizo33SHG3w45s4kBl2g

item.title: How Do We Talk About Racism?
item.description:
Diversity & Inclusion expert and blogger Charnaie Gordon joins Jillian to talk about how to have an open and honest conversation with your kids about race and racism.

Guest Links:

CharnaieGordon.com, HereWeeRead.com, @HereWeeRead on Instagram, Twitter, FaceBook, Pintrest

Charnaie’s Booklist from this episode:

For Toddlers:

Antiracist Baby by Ibram X. Kendi

Colors of Us by Karen Katz

All the Colors We Are by Katie Kissinger

Shades of People by Shelley Rotner & Sheila M. Kelly

For Older Children:

Stamped from the Beginning by Ibram X. Kendi

The Name Jar by Yangsook Choi

Something Happened in Our Town by Marianne Celano, Marietta Collins, Ann Hazzard

For Parents:

White Fragility by Robin Diangelo

item.description:
This week’s all about the brain, from the physical/emotional connection to sugar's affect, and psychotherapist and anxiety specialist John Tsilimparis, author of "Retrain Your Anxious Brain" and host of the new podcast, “Mindfulness for the Soul” breaks it all down for us.

item.title: USO Fitness Tour & Dr. V and Our Bones
item.description:
Completely inspired to do something more, Jillian has come up with a very cool project that will help the troops not only overseas, but when they come back home. Dr. Katja Van Herle (Board Certified UCLA Endocrinologist) joins Jillian to talk about osteoporosis. What an eye opener this segment is. Dr. V is very clear on what we have to do to stave off this incredibly debilitating bone crusher. You guys too! Then it's call time where Jillian answers questions on fitness, diet, nutrition and inspiration.

item.title: Our perception of food & Rogue Pharmacies
item.description:
If we're told it's healthy, we automatically think it's bad. Jillian gives us a revealing look at the psychology of how our food tastes. Next, Christine Jones, General Counsel for GoDaddy is Jillian's guests with some great info on battling rogue pharmacies plaguing the Internet. They come into our lives without us even realizing it. Cristine not only has great info , but some real solid advice on how to protect your kids from them. Then Jillian gets the chance to answer caller's questions on fitness, nutrition, inspiration and overall fitness.
See Privacy Policy at https://art19.com/privacy and California Privacy Notice at https://art19.com/privacy#do-not-sell-my-info.

item.title: Hello super bugs and Dr. V's Top 7
item.description:
